holidays.name: Salami Day
holidays.description: A delicious celebration dedicated to the savory and spicy cured meat we all love: salami! This day invites gourmands to enjoy salami in sandwiches, charcuterie boards, or even on pizza.
holidays.origin: Likely created by meat enthusiasts and foodies to honor a classic deli staple, its exact origin is unknown but it‚Äôs celebrated mostly in the US.
holidays.funFact: Salami was originally made by Italian farmers as a way to preserve meat for winter months using fermentation and curing.

holidays.name: International Day of Clean Air for Blue Skies
holidays.description: An important environmental awareness day dedicated to improving air quality worldwide and protecting human health by promoting cleaner air policies and lifestyles.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations General Assembly in 2019 to address growing global air pollution issues.
holidays.funFact: Breathing polluted air is responsible for an estimated 7 million premature deaths globally every year.

holidays.name: Street Music Day
holidays.description: A lively celebration of musicians bringing their tunes to the streets, filling public spaces with entertaining performances and spontaneous concerts.
holidays.origin: Started by street performers and supporters of local music culture to highlight the art of busking and free public music.
holidays.funFact: Busking has been a tradition since ancient times, believed to date back to Ancient Greece and Rome.

holidays.name: National Salami Day (United States)
holidays.description: Another tasty nod specifically in the US recognizing salami as a beloved deli meat for sandwiches, snacks, and culinary creativity.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday embraced by American sandwich shops and meat lovers everywhere.
holidays.funFact: The word 'salami' comes from the Italian word 'salare,' meaning 'to salt,' an essential step in preserving the meat.
